original_prompt:
I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - output zero

The module should always outputs a LOW.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - output out

The module should always drive 0 (or logic low).

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - output one

The module should always drive 1 (or logic high).
with_steering_implementation: The `always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n)` block is a sensitivity list that specifies the conditions under which the block should be executed. In this case, it specifies that the block should be executed on every positive edge of the clock (`posedge clk`) or on every negative edge of the reset signal (`negedge rst_n`). This means that the block will be executed whenever the clock signal changes state or when the reset signal changes state from high to low. The block contains a set of conditional statements that determine the value of the output port `one` based on the current values of the clock signal and the reset signal.

original_prompt:
I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  in  (32 bits)
 - output out (32 bits)

The module should reverse the byte order of a 32-bit vector.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  in
 - output out

The module should implement a NOT gate.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  in  (8 bits)
 - output out (8 bits)

The module should reverse the bit ordering of the input port and write
the result to the output port.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  in
 - output out

The module should behave like a wire.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  in
 - output out

The module should assign the output port to the same value as the input
port combinationally.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  in  (3 bits)
 - output out (2 bits)

The module should implement a "population count" circuit that counts the
number of '1's in the input vector.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  x
 - input  y
 - output z

The module should implement the boolean function z = (x^y) & x.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  a
 - input  b
 - output out

The module should implement a NOR gate.
without_steering_implementation:
module TopModule (
    input clk,
    input rst_n,
    input a,
    input b,
    output out
);

    reg nor_output;

    always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
        if (!rst_n) begin
            nor_output <= 1'b1; // Set default value for reset
        end else begin
            nor_output <= ~(a | b);
        end
    end

    assign out = nor_output;

endmodule

original_prompt:
I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  a
 - input  b
 - output out

The module should implement an XNOR gate.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  in1
 - input  in2
 - output out

The module should implement a 2-input NOR gate.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  a
 - input  b
 - output out

The module should implement a 2-input AND gate.

I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following
interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise
specified.

 - input  in     (16 bits)
 - output out_hi ( 8 bits)
 - output out_lo ( 8 bits)

The module should implement a combinational circuit that splits an input
half-word (16 bits, [15:0] ) into lower [7:0] and upper [15:8] bytes.
without_steering_implementation:
module SimpleCounter (
    input wire clk,
    input wire rst,
    output reg [3:0] count
);

always @(posedge clk or posedge rst) begin
    if (rst) begin
        count <= 4'b0000; // Reset to 0
    end else begin
        count <= count + 1; // Increment by 1
    end
end

endmodule
